abstract: As companies like Citigroup, Wells Fargo and Bank of America return their federal bailout money and raise new capital to replace it, Wall Street is seeing a special kind of payday.
snippet: As companies like Citigroup, Wells Fargo and Bank of America return their federal bailout money and raise new capital to replace it, Wall Street is seeing a special kind of payday.
lead_paragraph: As companies like Citigroup, Wells Fargo and Bank of America return their federal bailout money and raise new capital to replace it, Wall Street is seeing a special kind of payday, The New York Times’s Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.

headline.main: Repaying U.S. and Reaping Bounty in Fees
